STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 12, 2023
Jennifer Vasilovski
Family & Community Services- Livingston
3075 E. Grand River Ave
Howell, MI, 48843-6584
RE: License#: CB470382419
Dear Jennifer Vasilovski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/12/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
Two of three adoption evaluations were not completed within the required
timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/13/22 INTERIM, CAP approval 6/15/22
FOM 801-03 Medical passport
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect
the child's current and complete health information.
Three of eight foster care files were each missing one quarterly updated medical
passport.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/5/21 RENEWAL, CAP approved 5/11/21 (previously cited as FOM 801)
5/13/22 INTERIM, CAP approval 6/15/22

FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined… Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30
c alendar days before the case plan due date.
One of eight foster care files (two of twenty-seven service plans) did not have an
FTM within 30 days prior to the service plan due date.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/13/22 INTERIM, CAP approval 6/15/22
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Medical Passports must be updated quarterly, even if they are not required to
be provided to case members quarterly. It was recommended the worker date
the quarterly updated passport, as a date is not auto generated by the
system.
• Family adoption assessments must be completed within 90 days per rules.
However, if the agency has insufficient information to make a
recommendation, the report can be completed without a recommendation. An
addendum would then need to be completed once information is obtained and
a recommendation made.
• Case contacts entered in MiSACWIS must document all of the information
required by policy FOM 722-06H regarding quality home visits.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation not requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows: The CAP,
approved 6/15/2022, was a result of the 5/13/2022 interim review. In the interim
review, the agency had nine violations. During this renewal evaluation only three
violations were found. Although, all three are repeat violations, there were fewer
instances of each violation found in the case files during this review. Overall, the
agency has decreased the number of violations, and shown improvement in
several areas.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed. The
CAA identified treatment plan signatures, service plan approval, and updated
medical passports as an ongoing area where improvement is needed. The CAA
reported all other areas of the 2022 interim CAP have been implemented and
have shown improvement. The agency reported some unplanned moves during
the past year. Most of which were teenagers. The agency reported ongoing
difficulty locating and maintaining placements for this age group.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Three staff were interviewed by phone and in person. Staff reported they enjoy
working at the agency. Staff stated their supervisors are knowledgeable and
supportive. Administration is helpful and makes decisions that are beneficial to the
agency. Staff reported no concerns or suggestions for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in an office building. The building has sufficient space for
staff and secure storage of files. The office has adequate space for meetings,
trainings, and family visits.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
_ _____________April 12, 2023_______________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 12, 2023

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
